titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Laird Oâ€™Neill Miller, Jr. (1915-2000) was a pastoral counselor and educator. He received his Masters of Divinity from Western Theological Seminary and his Master of Sacred Theology from New York Theological Seminary. He served as a pastor in churches in Pennsylvania, Connecticut, and New Jersey. From 1968 to 1973, he was Stated Clerk of the Presbytery of Southern New England and was Moderator of the Synod of New England from 1972 to 1973.

scopecontent.p: This is a photostatic copy of Thaddeus Dod's "Covenant with God," with accompanying transcript and sermon by Laird O. Miller. The original Dod manuscript is held by Washington and Jefferson College. The transcription was made by Laird O. Miller in 1951. The collection also includes a typescript of a 1974 sermon preached by Laird Miller at the Noroton Presbyterian Church.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Miller, Laird O.; The photostatic copy was given to the Library of the Western Seminary by the Washington and Jefferson College Archivist, Mr. Charles Ewing.
